sections.title: Description
sections.content: Cronos (also spelled Kronos or Cronus) was the youngest and most powerful of the twelve Titans, ruling over the Golden Age before being overthrown by his own children. As lord of time and harvest, he embodied both agricultural abundance and the inexorable passage of ages. His most notorious act - devouring his own children to prevent the prophecy of his downfall - has become one of mythology's most powerful symbols of time consuming all things.

title: Greek - Cronos
archetype_description: Cronos embodies time and the cycle of generations - devouring his children as time consumes all.
domains: Harvest: God of agriculture and the grain harvest
